creator: mark@nimble.com
text:
I'm trying to create an application where we do not have internet connectivity 
(but would still like to use servlets).  Since the web.xml file references the 
file http://java.sun.com/j2ee/dtds/web-app_2_2.dtd which is remote, it requires 
some work to be done on the client's end to download and save the file, then 
reconfigure web.xml to refer to it locally.  Is there a better solution for 
using servlets without internet connectivity, or is the reconfiguration 
common?  And why not store the .dtd file locally in the first place?
Won't be addressed in Tomcat 3.2.2, but will be considered for later releases.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com

text:
The DTD is stored locally, and the parser instructed to use the local
copy. This was fixed for 3.3 and 3.2. If you still have the problem,
plese reopen the bug and add info about the parser you use.
